intro: Vrydagzynea rectangulata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Vrydagzynea rectangulata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
